children.title: What is a blockchain?
children.description: Introduces the basics of blockchain technology and terminology.
children.label: What is a blockchain?

children.title: Why build on a blockchain?
children.description: Introduces the basics of blockchain technology and terminology.
children.label: Why build on a blockchain?

children.title: Cryptography
children.description: Learn what we mean when we say crypto and the role of cryptography in blockchain development and smart contracts.
children.label: Cryptography

children.title: Why Kadena
children.description: Highlights the unique properties of the Kadena blockchain network with a high level overview.
children.label: Why Kadena

children.title: Consensus
children.description: Learn the basics about consensus models and the Kadena proof-of-work protocol.
children.label: Consensus

children.title: Chainweb simplified
children.description: Learn about the Chainweb consensus protocol and the multi-chain network in this simplified overview.
children.label: Chainweb simplified

children.title: Accounts, keys, and principals
children.description: Learn about how public and secret keys are used in accounts and how accounts Kadena blockchain differ from accounts and addresses on most blockchains.
children.label: Accounts, keys, and principals

children.title: Glossary
children.description: General and specific terminology related to Kadena.
children.label: Glossary

children.title: Kadena FAQ
children.description: Answers to commonly asked questions about Kadena.
children.label: Kadena FAQ

children.title: Kadena resources
children.description: Official links for Kadena whitepapers, videos, developer program, and social media.
children.label: Resources

title: Learn about Kadena
subTitle: Start with blockchain basics and core Kadena concepts
description: If you're new, start your journey with an introduction to blockchain technology and educational guides for both technical and non-technical audiences.
label: Introduction

children.title: Explore the blockchain
children.description: Add your name to the Kadena Memory Wall on the public blockchain, see the blockchain in action using a block explorer, and create a wallet on the test network to play a game.
children.label: Explore the blockchain

children.title: Deploy your first contract - Quick start
children.description: Learn how to set up a development environment and deploy your first smart contract on Kadena.
children.label: Deploy your first contract

children.title: Build with Command-line interface
children.description: The `@kadena/kadena-cli` library provides a complete set of commands for creating applications and interacting with the Kadena network interactively or by using scripts from the command-line.
children.label: Build with kadena-cli

children.title: Set up a local development network
children.description: Kadena makes blockchain work for everyone.
children.label: Set up a local network

children.title: Hello World
children.description: Kadena makes blockchain work for everyone.
children.label: Hello World

children.title: Explore Pact Language Basics
children.description: Kadena makes blockchain work for everyone.
children.label: Explore language basics

children.title: Modules
children.description: This tutorial introduces an essential feature in Pact known as modules. We’ll discuss what modules are, why they’re important, and how they relate to smart contracts.
children.label: Modules

children.title: Keysets
children.description: This tutorial introduces another essential feature in Pact known as keysets. We’ll discuss what keysets are, why they’re important, and how they help regulate access to Pact modules.
children.label: Keysets

children.title: Schemas and Tables
children.description: The goal of this tutorial is to get you familiar with what schemas and tables are, why they’re useful, and to demonstrate how to implement these within a Pact smart contract.
children.label: Schemas and Tables

children.title: Develop using Atom SDK
children.description: The goal of this tutorial is to get you up and running with the Pact environment and the Pact Atom SDK to begin running Pact programs locally.
children.label: Develop using Atom SDK

children.title: Accounts and Transfers
children.description: The goal of this tutorial is to help you build an application that transfers value between two accounts. To do this, you’ll build a smart contract that implements this functionality named Simple Payments. This is an important function of smart contracts and will set you up to create more complex applications using accounts and transfers.
children.label: Accounts and Transfers

children.title: Contract Interaction
children.description: The goal of this tutorial is to learn the basics of building interactions between modules in Pact. You will go over some of the fundamentals, then build a smart contract that allows users to both make and authorize payments using multiple Pact modules.
children.label: Contract Interaction

children.title: Rotatable Wallet
children.description: Here you’ll create a smart contract named Rotatable Wallets that demonstrates many important Pact features that you learned throughout previous tutorials.
children.label: Rotatable Wallet

children.title: Loans
children.description: In this tutorial, you will build an example loans application using many of the techniques you learned in earlier tutorials
children.label: Loans

children.title: Test in the SDK
children.description: In this tutorial, you will learn the basics of testing in the SDK to build your own REPL file. This is a great start to begin testing the smart contracts you build locally.
children.label: Test in the SDK

children.title: Deploy to a local server
children.description: The goal of this tutorial is to help you run and deploy a working Pact test server locally.
children.label: Deploy to a local server

children.title: Pact and JavaScript
children.description: The goal of this tutorial is to help you connect your Pact development environment to a front end application.
children.label: Pact and JavaScript

children.title: Safety Using Control Flow
children.description: In this tutorial, we’ll focus specifically on how Pact approaches control flow to ensure safety.
children.label: Safety

children.title: Interfaces with Pact
children.description: Throughout this tutorial you’ll learn why interfaces are valuable and how to implement them with Pact.
children.label: Interfaces with Pact

children.title: Built in Functions
children.description: In this guide, we will go through and explain specific built-in functions that are listed in the pact reference page
children.label: Built in Functions

children.title: Advanced concepts
children.description: Provides an in-depth look at core concepts for programming advanced applications using the Pact smart contract programming language and key features such as guard, capabilities, pacts, and module references.
children.label: Advanced concepts

children.title: Get started with Pact
children.description: Pact is a human-readable smart contract programming language, designed to enable correct, transactional execution on a high-performance blockchain. Start your builder's journey on Kadena by learning about the Pact smart contract programming language.
children.label: Get started with Pact

children.title: Get started with Marmalade
children.description: Learn how to mint a non-fungible token (NFT) using the Marmalade token standard on the Kadena blockchain.
children.label: Get started with Marmalade

children.title: Contract architecture
children.description: Build a non-fungible token (NFT) marketplace using the Marmalade token standard and Pact smart contracts.
children.label: Contract architecture

children.title: Describe tokens in metadata
children.description: Set token properties for digital assets using the Marmalade metadata standard.
children.label: Describe tokens in metadata

children.title: Store digital assets
children.description: Ensure the long-term storage and availability of non-fungible tokens.
children.label: Store digital assets

children.title: Create a non-fungible token
children.description: This guide demonstrates how to create a non-fungible token (NFT) from artwork to marketplace using the Marmalade standard with permanent storage on IPFS.
children.label: Create a non-fungible token

children.title: Create a token collection
children.description: This guide demonstrates how to create a non-fungible token collection using the Marmalade standard with permanent storage on IPFS.
children.label: Create a token collection

children.title: Explore example policies
children.description: Describes where to find and how to work with example policies.
children.label: Explore example policies

children.title: Create custom policies
children.description: Describes how to import and work with token policy interfaces to create custom token policies.
children.label: Create custom policies

children.title: Policies
children.description: Describes how to work with concrete and custom policies when you create tokens.
children.label: Use concrete policies

children.title: Auctions
children.description: Introduces the types of auctions you can implement for an NFT marketplace using Marmalade and the Kadena blockchain network.
children.label: Auctions

children.title: Start a sale
children.description: Demonstrates how to put a non-fungible token up for sale using a conventional auction as the sale type.
children.label: Start a sale

children.title: Create an auction
children.description: Demonstrates how to create a conventional auction to sell a token.
children.label: Create an auction

children.title: Sales
children.description: Describes the different ways you can offer tokens for sale and how to create and use sales-specific contracts.
children.label: Sale options

children.title: What is Marmalade?
children.description: Build a non-fungible token (NFT) marketplace using Marmalade and Pact smart contracts.
children.label: What is Marmalade?

children.title: Query building with GraphQL
children.description: The `@kadena/graph` library is a frontend GraphQL layer built on top of the Kadena blockchain that provides drill-down access to real-time and historical data.
children.label: Query building with GraphQL

children.title: Kadena client
children.description: The @kadena/client library provides a TypeScript-based API for interacting with smart contracts and Chainweb nodes on the Kadena network.
children.label: Kadena client

children.title: Register a Kadena SpireKey account
children.description: Whether you're a user or developer, creating a Kadena SpireKey account is the first step to using simplified WebAuthn authentication and authorization services.
children.label: Register an account

children.title: Integrate decentralized applications
children.description: If you're an application developer, you can leverage Kadena SpireKey accounts and WebAuthN authentication and authorization services by connecting to Kadena SpireKey endpoints from your application.
children.label: Integrate decentralized apps

children.title: Create transactions for Kadena SpireKey
children.description: If you're an application developer, you can enable users to sign transactions using their Kadena SpireKey account by constructing the transaction in the proper format and sending the unsigned transaction to the SpireKey endpoint.
children.label: Create transactions

children.title: Recover Kadena SpireKey accounts
children.description: If you're an application developer and have integrated Kadena SpireKey accounts and WebAuthn authentication and authorization services into your application, you can also implement account recovery using a Kadena SpireKey passkey.
children.label: Recover accounts

children.title: Authenticate and sign with Kadena SpireKey
children.description: Provide authentication and authorization services by implementing Kadena SpireKey in your decentralized application.
children.label: Authentication overview

children.title: Code templates for common use cases
children.description: Provides TypeScript and Pact code templates for performing common tasks with Pact and the Kadena client.
children.label: Code templates

children.title: Prepare your workspace
children.description: Get started with the Election workshop by downloading project code and exploring the directories and application frontend.
children.label: Prepare your workspace

children.title: Start a local blockchain
children.description: Start the development network blockchain on your local computer and explore the smart contracts available by default.
children.label: Start a local blockchain

children.title: Add an administrator account
children.description: Create an administrative account for the election application to control access to specific functions.
children.label: Add administrator account

children.title: Define a namespace
children.description: Learn how to define a unique namespace for your smart contracts, keysets, and Pact modules.
children.label: Define a namespace

children.title: Define keysets
children.description: Learn how to define keysets in your principal namespace.
children.label: Define keysets

children.title: Write a smart contract
children.description: Use the Pact smart contract language to build the scaffolding for the election application smart contract backend.
children.label: Write a smart contract

children.title: Nominate candidates
children.description: Work with database schemas and tables in your Pact module to manage candidates for the election application smart contract backend.
children.label: Nominate candidates

children.title: Add vote management
children.description: Add voting and vote counting functionality to the election application in the Pact module smart contract backend.
children.label: Add vote management

children.title: Add a gas station
children.description: Prepare a gas station module to pay the transaction fees for account holders who cast votes in the election application.
children.label: Add a gas station

children.title: Workshop: Election application
children.description: Learn how to build a decentralized application that registers votes on the Kadena blockchain.
children.label: Welcome

children.title: Workshop: Faucet application
children.description: Learn how to write a faucet application using the Pact smart contract language.
children.label: Workshop: Faucet application

children.title: Prepare your workspace
children.description: Get started with the NFT marketplace workshop by starting a local blockchain network.
children.label: Prepare your workspace

children.title: Workshop: NFT marketplace
children.description: Learn how to create, mint, sell, and buy tokens using Marmalade marketplace smart contracts on the Kadena blockchain.
children.label: Deploy token contracts locally

children.title: Sequenced transactions in pacts
children.description: The Pact smart contract language features pacts, a form of coroutine that allows for orchestrating a sequence of transactions, as might be found in an escrow process. In this document we discuss the two motivating scenarios under which pacts find their ideal use-case for private, confidential transactions it enables single-actor process serialization with automatic rollbacks for public, trustless two-party escrow with rules preventing early cancel by the debtor.
children.label: Sequenced pacts

children.title: Client utilities
children.description: The `@kadena` libraries provide a TypeScript based application programming interface API for interacting with smart contracts and the Kadena network. The libraries include helper functions for many common tasks in core Pact modules, such as the `coin` module, and `core` functions that you can use to develop new interfaces for custom contracts.
children.label: Client utilities

children.title: Pact-JS
children.description: The `@kadena/pactjs` library provides a TypeScript based application programming interface (API) for interacting with Pact smart contracts and the Kadena network.
children.label: Pactjs

children.title: pactjs-cli
children.description: The `@kadena/pactjs-cli` library provides a TypeScript based application programming interface API for interacting with smart contracts and the Kadena network. This library enables you to generate TypeScript definitions for Pact modules to work with Kadena client libraries.
children.label: Pactjs-cli

children.title: PactJS generator
children.description: The `@kadena/pactjs-generator` library generates TypeScript definitions of Pact contracts for use in @kadena/pactjs projects.
children.label: Pactjs-generator

children.title: Cryptographic utilities
children.description: The `@kadena/cryptography-utils` library provides a collection of utility functions to perform common cryptographic operations, including generating a hash for transactions.
children.label: Cryptographic utilities

children.title: Client libraries
children.description: The `@kadena/client` and `@kadena/client-utils` libraries provide a TypeScript based application programming interface API for interacting with smart contracts and the Kadena network.
children.label: Client libraries

title: Reference
subTitle: Find technical reference information all in on place
description: Find technical reference information for the Pact smart contract language, the Chainweb protocol, and other Kadena tools.
label: Introduction
